issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: Tested on cloud in VPC mode. "No VPC" is available among options on security group creation dialog. When s.group is created with this selection, a VPC is assigned to the group anyway.
fields.summary: In VPC mode "No VPC" option can be chosen in eucaconsole

comments.body:
[~alice], can't a cloud still do things in classic mode when it has VPC enabled? The No VPC option *should* still be there, right? SO the bug is that the security group is created in VPC, not classic, yes?

CC: [~sjones]

[~jloza], it depends if there is a default VPC. When a default VPC is in place then resources are created in that VPC if a VPC is not specified. In Eucalyptus, when VPC is enabled you can either have a default VPC or the action will fail as we do not support EC2-Classic and VPC at the same time.

Thanks, [~sjones]...this means we have a MUCH larger issue in the console, and will have to redo a bunch of stuff. 

How can we tell if the euca cloud is in VPC mode? We need to know this so we know what to display in the console.

If you have appropriate permissions, the DescribeAccountAttributes will show the supported platforms and if there is a default VPC. I would change the label from "No VPC" to "No / Default VPC" (or similar)

Here is the scope of fixes required for this ticket. We still need to know how we can tell if the cloud is in VPC mode, please, [~sjones].

When Euca + VPC Mode:

Instances
	1) launch 
		remove No VPC option from selections, be sure default VPC network is the default selection
	2) landing page
		remove No VPC option from filter selections

security groups
	1) create 
		remove No VPC option from selections, be sure default VPC network is the default selection
	2) landing page
		remove No VPC option from filter selections

ip addresses
	1) allocate
		make scope value flat text instead of selection widget
	2) landing page
		hide scope filter completely

launch configs
	1) create should hide vpc ip assignment unless vpc is enabled
        2) launch configs detail page: hide vpc assignment when vpc not enabled

scaling groups
	1) create 
		remove No VPC option from selections, be sure default VPC network is the default selection

EUCA + NOT VPC MODE

hide all the VPC stuff everywhere, except the IP allocate dialog, show scope "standard" as flat text instead of within a widget

We should not require the user specify a VPC when in VPC mode, the point of a default VPC is to avoid users having to specify a VPC if they do not care. 

Use the DescribeAccountAttributes action to check if in VPC mode (i.e. the supported platforms):

http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/ApiReference-query-DescribeAccountAttributes.html
OK, thanks [~sjones]. [~kyolee], I am revising the comment above to reflect what Steve said.
[~kyolee]: Feel free to clean up https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1196 per my comments before you submit this ticket for review.

[~jloza] For LaunchConfig Pages, the field VPC IP Assignment needs to be removed in case of no vpc eucalyptus case.

[~sjones] Would it ever be a case where Eucalyptus is running as "VPC" mode, but has no default VPC assigned to it, thus returning [u'none'] for the default-vpc attribute?
[~kyolee], absolutely, the default vpc for an account can be deleted so there may not be a default vpc available.
[~kyolee], thanks for the heads-up, updated wireframes and edited my comment above to indicate changes.

Pull request is ready for review at

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1196

[~kyolee], looks good, however, I think the "no subnets" option should not be displayed on the scaling groups landing page filter set when EUCA + VPC MODE, since they are required, right? We missed that the first time around.

EUCA + NOT VPC MODE:

Launch instance wizard is broken, next button on step 2 is disabled for no reason (screenshot attached)

The pull request has been updated to remove the No VPC option from the scaling group filter:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1196

Launch instance wizard issue is not related to this branch, tracked on the ticket GUI-1509
Updated branch passed UX review, ready for code review. Did not UX review against AWS since no changes should have been required for AWS.
